docs.lead_paragraph: Clinton and Obama are together again. She said something. He forgave her. You would think they were professional politicians!
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column examines aftermath of Hillary Clinton interview in The Atlantic in which she criticized Pres Obama's foreign policies; applauds interview for bringing up issues that deserve further discussion, and calls for more in-depth examination ahead of 2016 elections, particularly in regard to Clinton's stance; notes Clinton seems to have backed away from conflict and has made up with Obama.
docs.snippet: Clinton and Obama are together again. She said something. He forgave her. You would think they were professional politicians!...

docs.lead_paragraph: The bride is a second-year dermatology resident at the teaching hospitals of Harvard, in Boston. The groom is an assistant professor of medicine at Harvard Medical School.
docs.snippet: The bride is a second-year dermatology resident at the teaching hospitals of Harvard, in Boston. The groom is an assistant professor of medicine at Harvard Medical School....

docs.lead_paragraph: Aired Wednesday night on NBC: Of course, another two primaries yesterday. That's the big story. Very tough night for Hillary Clinton, who says she isn't dropping out because there are still six states that haven't had their Democratic primary. That's right. Yep. Barack Obama's favored in the states of Oregon, Montana and South Dakota, and Hillary is favored in the state of denial.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since we conservatives believe in giving credit where credit is due, it falls to us to praise Hillary Clinton.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most valuable lessons the gritty Hillary Clinton can teach the languid Barack Obama — and the timid Democrats — is that the whole point of a presidential race is to win.
docs.snippet: One of the most valuable lessons the gritty Hillary Clinton can teach the languid Barack Obama — and the timid Democrats — is that the whole point of a presidential race is to win....

docs.lead_paragraph: Over at The Caucus, Anne E. Kornblut watches Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton on The View so you don't have to. The senator touted the re-release of "It Takes a Village" and talked about her passion for Christmas: She and Bill stay up into the wee hours reminiscing as they unpack old ornaments. Just don't ask about Iraq or Obama. Details.
docs.abstract: From the Caucus: Hillary talks about Christmas but dodges questions about Iraq.
docs.snippet: From the Caucus: Hillary talks about Christmas but dodges questions about Iraq....

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Clinton, sweeping through the Sunday morning talk shows after her somewhat upstaged Thanksgiving visit to the war zones, startled her conservative detractors by emerging as a congenital hawk. (I used that adjective ''congenital,'' in the sense of ''habitual,'' in derogation of her credibility back when the world was young.) She does not go along with the notion that the Iraqi dictator posed no danger to the U.S.: ''I think that Saddam Hussein was certainly a potential threat'' who ''was seeking weapons of mass destruction, whether or not he actually had them.''
docs.abstract: William Safire Op-Ed column on Sen Hillary Clinton's stand in support of war in Iraq, but critical of Bush administration policies there; cites political implications for 2004 and 2008 presidential races (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Those who think Hillary Rodham Clinton should have left Bill Clinton overlook the responsibility she has to the nation, the presidency and the continuity of an administration that has been so successful in spite of an antagonistic opposition-party majority (Op-Ed, Oct. 12).
docs.abstract: Jan Guardiano letter on Hillary Clinton's choice to remain with her husband, Pres Bill Clinton
